turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I'd like to talk with you about doing some performance poetry here....A weekly thing.

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: Hmm, I see possibilities but you got a lot to do.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: We should be done by the weekend.

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I could pencil you in if you like?

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: I'll take a rain-check for now.

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: Turned Czech huh?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Yeah, maybe.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Lawrence is getting derogatory again.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: Shhhhh, I'm concentrating!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I think he's jealous of Havel.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: So why don't you get up and speak something, then we will see who is crazy.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Ooh, well excuse me.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: Why don't you read something after the break? DOUG What here? Weren't you listening to what I just said?

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: You used to read.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Well not any more, now I'm a serious writer and above this crap.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: Well, get me and Chris a drink then.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I'll get the drinks, but not here. Let's split. I can't stand this any more, it's murdering my respect for literature.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: But I don't want to go, I am enjoying it.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: How about you Brutus?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: So what's it going to be, Coogan's or U Vayvudoo?

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: I don't care. I'm not staying out late Doug.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: I'm not staying out late and I can't come back to your place.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Whatever!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: A word of advice my celibate friend. These Czech girls look like dynamite and go like it, but don't be fooled; there's a price to be paid and it's going up fast. Right Kat?

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: You're everything a guy could want.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: It's just talk, he's drunk.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: No I'm not, I came to Prague looking for something - this could be it!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Don't give me this Kat, I'm doing it for you and your country.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: What? You are crazy!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Look, just hear me out, okay?

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: Doug I can't, I've got to be at work by eight. You promised to take me home.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Look Kat it'll only take ten minutes. Without Jahn I might never find it... We'll just have a quick look and then you and I'll hit a tram.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: I don't want to get in trouble.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Don't worry it's okay!

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: I'm not going in Doug. I'll wait for you here.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Okay, whatever. Come on Chris!

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: Doug you said you wouldn't be long. Come on, I've got to go. Now!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Alright, I'm coming. It's the perfect place Jahn, thanks.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: It's not fair, you hardly talked to me tonight.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I'm sorry but it's been a crazy evening. I'm going to make that place into something big. God, I love you!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Let's walk over the bridge, we haven't done that for a while.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: We should go to the Metro it's quicker.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Nonsense, we can pick up the tram on the other side, it won't take any longer. Come on!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Kat, I'm in paradise. I don't ever want to leave.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: So, we won't be going to London?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: No, not just yet.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I hope you're going to invite me in?

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: Everybody is at home, it's no good.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Let's have a look anyway.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: She's tired.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: It's bad news when you can't even bribe kids.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I want you so bad. She'll be asleep soon, maybe we could do it quietly under the sheets.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: No way Doug, I can't.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Yeah, you're right.... I've got an idea!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Beer please! Do you want another drink?

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: Fernet and tonic.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: I think I'm stupid.....All you do is use me and expect me to wait for you.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: I thought you loved me Doug but all you want from me is sex.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: That's not true, we have a great time together. I've said I'm sorry. Let's forget about it and go stop by my place, so I can get changed.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: Oh sure and you will want sex, always sex.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: I could have my choice of many boyfriends and go to movies and discos but I waste my time waiting for you and then going to stupid pubs.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I'm not a bloody teenager okay, I told you I can't do that shit.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: That's it, I am just stupid teenager, yes?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Right now, yeah - you're talking crap.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: No, I love you, really.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: Then tell me, what will happen? Tell me!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Look, I love you Katka but I'm twelve years older, I could never marry you, it'd be stupid, you know that!

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: I thought for sure they would catch me.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: Will it help to get you out?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I hope so!

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: If you get out can we be together again.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I'm no good for you Katka, besides I won't be able to stay in Prague.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: But we could go to London and live in England.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: No Kat, I lied to you, I hate England and I don't ever want to live there again.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: I don't understand, it's your home?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: There's nothing there for me.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: I'm sorry about what I said, really I am. Just take me with you, I don't care where.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Forget about me Kat.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: But I love you!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: It was a mistake, I never wanted to hurt you, but it had to end sooner or later and now, well now I love someone else.

turns.speaker: KATKA
turns.text: No, it's not true, you're lying.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Not this time, Kat.

turns.speaker: JAHN
turns.text: Yeah, for sure.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: And, since it's only two streets away, I suggest we go take a look. Now!

turns.speaker: JAHN
turns.text: No, I am an actor not a labourer, I am just warning you, that's all.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Don't worry, I've got lots of friends.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Interesting. Do reckon I could fit through here?

turns.speaker: JAHN
turns.text: Sure, I've done it easily.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Hey Chris, keep an eye on things.

turns.speaker: JAHN
turns.text: Hi, want to take up dancing?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Later. Jahn, I've been let down by the guys who were going to do the flooring. They brought the materials but took my money and ran. You guys have a school theatre don't you?

turns.speaker: JAHN
turns.text: Yes, The Obelisk but it's closed for repairs.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: So I hear, do you know some of the stage hands?

turns.speaker: JAHN
turns.text: Sure, they are students.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Well, I want them to put down a floor and a walkway.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: There's three thousand crowns, it's all I got.

turns.speaker: JAHN
turns.text: It's not so much.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Look, if you can get them to finish it by Friday, you and your friends can do the opening performance that night.

turns.speaker: JAHN
turns.text: Can we charge admission?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Donations only! And make the thing non-lingual, so everyone gets a handle on it.

turns.speaker: JAHN
turns.text: I'll do my best. Is the place open.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Yep, it's all yours.

turns.speaker: JAHN
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: JAHN
turns.text: They'll do it.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Great. And your all set for the performance?

turns.speaker: JAHN
turns.text: Yeah, it's a simple piece. If they get the floor done in time, me and the others will rehearse tomorrow afternoon, but it's not critical.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Don't go making it too simple, we're on the cutting edge here.

turns.speaker: JAHN
turns.text: No thanks, I must go, but maybe you could get some beers for the guys.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Don't worry. Thanks.

turns.speaker: JAHN
turns.text: Yes, it's looks good.....We will use this for the soundtrack and we will have two guys up there with the spotlights. The others will just be house lights.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Great....How long will it go for?

turns.speaker: JAHN
turns.text: About forty minutes.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Cool....So, if we say eight o'clock.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Okay?

turns.speaker: STUDENT
turns.text: Yo, dobree!

turns.speaker: STUDENT
turns.text: It is okay........We will paint the wood black, yes?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Yeah, great....Dobchay! It will dry, yes?

turns.speaker: STUDENT
turns.text: Yes, of course...maybe one hour.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Good, great....Dobchay!

turns.speaker: STUDENT
turns.text: Tomorrow, we will bring some lights and also hang some fabric. I think it will be finished in the morning.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: It's perfect, you've done a great job.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: You mean you don't know, Henry! We got a bunch of anarchists, controlling a six-level block of luxury apartments down on Janovska street here in the Old Town, and you don't know about it?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Ah, so what?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: That's only the half of it. I've heard a rumour they're taking over a theatre to use for alternative arts; you know what that means?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Henry, these guys already push most of the drugs in this town and now they want to move into pornography, right? Believe me, it won't stop there either, next it'll be a church and pretty soon they'll have their own department store or something...... Henry, we've got to stop them. The foundation's got to put an end to it!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I'm in close with these guys, it isn't easy, but slowly they're opening up to me. Give me a month and I'll blow their movement wide open.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: A month, Jesus! And how do I know you're not crapping me?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: You can hold back this months pay-check until I come through with the story.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What pay-check? You ain't done nothing!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Henry, I've been working my tail off on this. Look, all I need is a little cash to loosen up some tongues and you've got the scoop. It'll send those scum-bags down for life; be a big feather in the cap for the Bugler and your board of directors back home!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I got a bad feeling about this.... How much do you need?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Two hundred dollars, make it six thousand crowns?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: There's three thousand and if you don't come through, I'm going throw you clean out of that window. Deal?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Deal!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: And take Jiri with you?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Insurance!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Any chance of getting me out on bail?

turns.speaker: JAROSLAV
turns.text: What is bail?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Will they free me?

turns.speaker: JAROSLAV
turns.text: I don't know - maybe they are talking about it now. Mr Vitovetch is a good friend of the Judge.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Will this thing take long?

turns.speaker: JAROSLAV
turns.text: No, it should be over soon.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: You mean it's started?

turns.speaker: JAROSLAV
turns.text: Of course, you can see that lady over there, she is recording everything.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: How do I know what's being said?

turns.speaker: JAROSLAV
turns.text: I will tell you - within a week I will have the transcript and we can go through it.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: No act of love but willing violence demanded by one and begged by the other. As life turned to fantasy and reality to ecstasy a need, so deep no light could reach, surfaced like a nocturnal creature unearthed for momentary and glorious display. Left alone in a rose-tinted afterglow dimming fast she tasted the moisture of her body and wondered why light came to day and such desires to her pale-skin body.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Well she sure isn't normal.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I'll put one on the notice-board too.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Am I invited?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Sure as long as you don't bring that prick Josh. Thanks Lawrence.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I thought I'd help out.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: We don't need you.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: That's not what you said last night. And, I didn't bring that "prick" Josh.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Alright, go help Chris shovel up the last of the crap.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Seems a shame!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: The way I look at it, I've carried the camel to water and stuffed it's head under - if it doesn't drink now, we might as well shoot the thing and call it a day.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Why are you doing all this, what for?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Well, I've failed at everything else I've done and I can't hack it as a journalist, even for the Bugler.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: What's the Bugler?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: It's a student magazine networked through Eastern Europe and funded by Republican do-gooders back in the States.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I figured you more as a Socialist?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I moving more to Communism now it's dying out.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: A champion of lost causes huh?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: No, I'm just running scared, same as everyone else.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: We_re not all running away

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I know, some are trapped, usually by money.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Shall I wash these out?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Yeah, we'd better keep them for now, I'll try and get some glasses for tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Is it dry?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Yeah seems okay.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: What would you like, beer?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: No, just a coffee.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: One beer, one coffee, thanks.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I'd better get you to a hospital.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I'll be okay, just get me home.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: It's all my fault, I'm so sorry Doug.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I had it coming from someone.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Are you sure I shouldn't get a doctor.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Who you saving the dishes for?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Guests.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Don't you have a girlfriend?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Sometimes.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I'd better get going, do you need a hand to get into bed?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Sure!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Did you take your things over to my place?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Uh-huh!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Run into Josh?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah, but it was okay.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: How did he look?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Better than you.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Hmm, I still owe him.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Why don't we both forget about him?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Alright!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Head the flyers up with Asylum and then put Debut of....Psychosis, Theatre experimental. That'll cover us if it flops. On the bottom put seek Asylum where the stars shine on Betlemska.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Cool!

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Weren't you going to get some glasses?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Oh shit, yeah. Can you lend some more money?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Where did you steal the car?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: It's Josh's.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Cool....Either of you know the way to Krakow?

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: This is your doing?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Yes, they had nothing to do with it.

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: And you broke into that room?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: You will wish you hadn't.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Fuck you!

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: Why did you break into that particular building?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: It was the biggest I could find.

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: What was the real purpose behind this venture?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: A kind of freedom.

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: Either you're a liar or you are a fool.

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: Enjoying our hospitality?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: We'll have to see what more we can do for you, while you are still our guest.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Thanks, but I don't intend to stay.

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: Really!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I lied to you, I didn't destroy the floppy disks.

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: Good try Mr. Greenwell but a little late. We have analyzed the contents of that drum, the remains of the disks are there, just as you said.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Not all of them!

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: You are playing a very dangerous game, I suggest you make it easy on yourself and tell me where they are.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I didn't get to see what's on the disks but I can guess. Do you want to hear my terms or not.

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: What is it you want?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: First, I want to walk free with a letter, in English, from the Prosecutor General dropping all charges. Second, I want two first class tickets to London leaving tonight and three thousand crowns in a stamped envelope. Lastly, all actions against the students are to be stopped!

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: I'm not sure it's possible.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: The choice is yours, it's not negotiable.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: And the students?

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: I have the Director's word, there will be no action against them. You may go once we have the disks.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: How do I know this isn't a trap?

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: You have the letter and my word, if you wish you may wait upstairs....Now, where are the disks?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: I'll need to make a phone call.

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: You may use my office.

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: Would you like your things now?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: Release Mr Greenwell's possessions.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Central station, locker number 139 - combination JFK.

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: Good, wait here, it will not take long and then you may go.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: We had a deal!

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: Yes, you are free to go, Karel here will drive you home.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: That's okay I like the metro, it's only a couple of stops from here.

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: I insist, it is the least we can do.

turns.speaker: HONZA
turns.text: Hey Doug, where you been?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Working....Under cover.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: No, just a drill.

turns.speaker: HONZA
turns.text: A drill, what are you up to?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Nothing. I've got to put up some kitchen shelves that's all. You've got one haven't you?

turns.speaker: HONZA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: And a fifty foot extension lead?

turns.speaker: HONZA
turns.text: You don't have fifty foot of apartment!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Come on, don't me give a hard time. I'm just trying to make the place look nice for Katka.

turns.speaker: HONZA
turns.text: Sure!

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Give me a break, will you. How often do I ask you for something?

turns.speaker: HONZA
turns.text: Okay, Okay, but I want it right back. It belongs to my father.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: No problem, is it at your place?

turns.speaker: HONZA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Great, let's break for lunch and I'll buy you a beer on the way.

turns.speaker: HONZA
turns.text: But I have to finish this....

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Come on, that shit can wait.

turns.speaker: HONZA
turns.text: So, he didn't fire you?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: No way, he even gave me back pay.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: When the hell did you write that?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Just yesterday.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Shit Honey, you could've told me. People might think it's about us!

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Maybe it is!

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: All I'm saying Honey is run the thing past me for Christ's sake before you get up and broadcast the crap.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Oh that's it? Everything I do is crap!

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I decided to help out at the Asylum.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: See you brought one of the patients with you too.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Josh!

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Well come on, sit down.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Yeah, so I hear. Don't you think you should go get changed?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Later.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Okay honey, but don't be long. I got plans.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: I think we should be going honey.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Well, for a start, you've got to get cleaned up.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I don't want to go.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: It's time to go home, Holly.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Come on Holly!

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Leave me, just leave me alone Josh.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: That's my bag.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Go to hell!

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: It's more than what you're worth.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You bastard!

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Yeah and you're a slut, so what?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Shall I look after the rest?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Don't you dare, I'll be back!

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Honey what a pleasant surprise, sorry to keep you waiting.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Josh, I have to speak you, it's urgent.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Of course Darling, you'd like to apologise?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Can we talk in your office?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: So, what have you got to say for yourself? Was he good in bed?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Josh, I need your help. Doug's been arrested, he's in big trouble. I thought maybe your father and the Embassy might be able to do something.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: You really are a piece of work, you know that? You walk out on me and my family for some worthless bum and you expect us to help him when he screws up.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Will you come home and forget all about him?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yes, if you can get him free.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Alright, I'll see to it and things'll be just as they were, okay?

turns.speaker: MIRA
turns.text: Why are there still such headlines?

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: This press we cannot control. Americans, I think.

turns.speaker: MIRA
turns.text: You know everyone can be controlled Pavel. Where are you storing the personnel files?

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: In a building belonging to the University in the Old Town.

turns.speaker: MIRA
turns.text: You are quite sure it's secure?

turns.speaker: PAVEL
turns.text: The files are in a sealed room and the University are under strict orders to stay away.

turns.speaker: MIRA
turns.text: The storage facility will be ready within a week, I'll call you then.
